content: Is there a reason why InfSet and SupSet aren't instances automatically constructed from LinearOrderedAddCommGroup?
How would they be? There isn't always a sensible value for them (e.g. the surreals are a LinearOrderedAddCommGroup)

Daniel Weber said:

How would they be? There isn't always a sensible value for them (i.e. the surreals are a LinearOrderedAddCommGroup)

Right! I was thinking it would be automatically constructed for some finite set of a LinearOrderedAddCommGroup - though, I did not specify this in my original thought - my bad!

Daniel Weber said:

There is docs#Finset.sup and docs#Finset.inf for finite sets

Missed this! Thanks! The conversation above was very helpful because I forgot to add finite as a constraint to the set I was working with.
There's also docs#Finset.max when you have a linear order.
The rationals are a LinearOrderedAddCommGroup, and those clearly don't have general infima and suprema.
